user_name: I think more people having a positive experience need to write down reviews and not only the ones having a negative one. I just went into the branch this morning and a gentleman at reception helped me almost straightaway. I explained to him …
I would like to compliment Lewis Craghill for his excellent support, as he fully understood my situation and did an amazing job, solving the situation in the best possible way.

Went to open an account, the person at the reception was condescending and rude. After I decided to just walk away, she wouldn’t even let me stay at the counter while I was putting all the paperwork back into my backpack.
Very friendly customer service experience :) and super helpful!
No appointment system. Extremely slow service. Wasting customer time.
Terrible customer service, staff are rude and dismissive every time I go in.
Worst service.. made me to visit 5 times totally. .. no proper explanation and proper review.  The manager is very rude ..
Worst service I've ever seen in a bank and incompetent staff.
Worst service I had experience with a bank.  Not enough people working there so had to wait  over an hour to see someone to help me, and lady was very unfriendly.

Appalling Customer service I ever experienced!. Had to wait for nearly an hour to be served and Premier area is deserted like a Ghost town!. I urge HSBC to show rapacious approach and improve their customer service pronoto!
$hitty service from one of the worst banks on the high street. Worst banks in order: 1. HSBC. 2. Barclays. 3.TSB. 4. Halifax. 5. Bank of scotland.

Last September came to open the student account. As I needed the appointment and I didn't booked one, I was advised to wait 20 min, as one of the appointments could have be cancelled soon. I was taken by one of the staff ladies, which was extremely nice and helpful, who changed my account into the student one.

Kasia was absolutely phenomenal!! Not only was she extremely professional she knew exactly what she was talking about and assisted me with choosing the right product. The whole process was seamless and super efficient. She was clear, …
Get your web site correct. Opening hours for princess street days 6pm yet I got there and it's 5pm. 4 people turned up whilst I were there swearing.  Customer service is key

I opened a bank account with HSBC over the phone and was asked to go to a branch to verify my documents. Due to a time crunch, I was advised to just do a walk-in at this branch. I was served by Sarah Stevenson and she did a fantastic job explaining all the details and getting the job done. Good experience.
Rude and incompetent staff.
The first contact staff provided incorrect information and I've wasted 45 minutes before finding out they could not help. Unbelievably frustrating.

Called about opening an account, had an appointment within 5 days, the appointment went well (they specified exactly which documents were necessary) and the account was open. Minus one star, because then they sent me the card and PIN to my …

HSBC UK is absolutely useless to contact by phone especially from Australia.  You cannot seem to contact a branch but get kicked into the worldwide system and wait and wait and wait.  There is never a good time and as a customer service it …

I had to go there 3 times to open a bank account and each time they asked for a different document or found something wrong with the documentation I took with me which was exactly what was asked. Each time I went there I felt less welcomed …

I'm not sure how many stars to give as the HSBC branch I'm in is very nice, and they're allowing me to sit in the Premier area and write this rather negative review about them. And the staff member who met me was very friendly, and equally …
Premier staff is nice and helpful. Got my account open fast and get all my question explained well. Thank you.
Went there three times to open a bank account, in the end the staff asked me to apply online, useless staff service

You walk in, the staff are helpful, you use the machines and walk out again, whether it is paying in a cheque or drawing money out. I prefer this arrangement where staff are there to help with your transaction rather than other banks where …
Rude and pretentious staff. Unprofessional and unwilling to help someone not from Edinburgh.

I've been a business banking customer here for years - everything is fine unless you need to speak to them about anything.  Then it's like trying wrangle an invitation to a meeting of the secretive Bilderberg Group.  I don't know why they bother having people in the branch - they never speak to anybody.
Dunno what half the folk on here are on about. I've had nothing but superb customer service from the folks in here.

Summary based on some family interactions: --doesn't really recognize Premier status for family members conducting business solo --convenient if in New Town area  The whole point of being Premier is to get better than average service, but maybe it's a cultural issue. Better experience than Paris, at any rate.
Nice staff and very modern when I comes to things like deposits due to it being self service
Good bank for newcomers to the UK, and for residents. Consistently good rates for mortgages. My favourite in Edinburgh

Friendly staff will help where they can, even if the query is not bank related. I was in doing some banking and decided to ask about some local knowledge and they tried to help. Good customer service is about being helpful whatever the query. Thanks

Was treated horribly by staff member Stefan Kerins, and my visit did not satisfy the reasons I had went in. This individual was obnoxious, rude, argumentative and did not have a single clue about the insurance benefits that HSBC current …
Weirdly automated branch with all basic services provided via self-service machines.  Some staff on hand to help, but be prepared to do most of it yourself.
I dislike their customer service setup- seems impersonal and meant to cut costs. Anything you need to get done has to be booked and reserved in advance.

This bank orientated toward online / international banking, so if you're looking for lots of branches and old fashioned one on one customer service, go elsewhere. If you want great international banking, linking accounts in different …
Been banking with HSBC for ten years, always good customer service by phone and in branch.

Went to the branch on 3 February 2016. HSBC had written to us asking for Certified copy of our Passports to deal with a PPI problem. A staff member Stephan Kerins messed about with us for half an hour. Finally said he would put the copies …
Michael Winn - Should that not be an exclamation mark rather than a question mark after stating that all banks are useless?   "You stay classy Sandiego!....I'm Ron Burgundy?"

Information given by the branch contradicted with that obtained through helpline!! Double standards! Had to revisit just to provide some form of proof of my identity, regardless the fact that I had been with them for almost 10 years! Re-edited..worth one only star
Better but busier than the one at Hanover street

Thought it was fine....until money i have paid into an account has disappeared either through human error or dishonesty...cant call hanover branch...only call centre abroad which is absolutely useless as they can only answer …
Worst bank service ever in Edinburgh. Been there 5 times, never once a good experience. Staff doesn't help much in anything.

I went there to have a bank account, it was necessary for start my new job. Every time there was a problem with documentation, although I am a European citizen. i went there 3 times in a week and when all my documents was ready i had my …
All in order. Thank you.
